material_metadata.name: Copper Ore
material_metadata.narrative: A soft, reddish metal found in shallow veins near the surface. Easy to work with basic tools but lacks the durability needed for serious combat. The foundation of all smithing - every blacksmith's first lesson.

material_metadata.name: Iron Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Sturdy grey metal from common deposits throughout the land. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, and strong enough for most purposes.

material_metadata.name: Tin Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Soft, silvery-white metal with a mysterious sheen that glows faintly in moonlight. Ancient texts speak of its lunar affinity.

material_metadata.name: Steel Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Harder and more durable than pure iron. The secret of its strength lies in its carbon-rich structure. A true warrior's metal.

material_metadata.name: Mithril Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Legendary silver-white metal that seems to drink in moonlight and starshine. Impossibly light yet incredibly strong.

material_metadata.name: Adamantine Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Dark, impossibly hard metal that absorbs light. Found only in the deepest caverns where the world's bones are exposed.

material_metadata.name: Orichalcum Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Gleaming golden metal with an otherworldly green-blue sheen. Ancient civilizations built empires on its discovery.

material_metadata.name: Etherion Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Metal that simultaneously exists in multiple states. Scholars argue whether it's matter or energy, present or future. It is all of these and none.

material_metadata.name: Oak Log
material_metadata.narrative: Reliable, sturdy timber from ancient oaks. Dense grain, strong fibers, and a warm golden-brown hue. The standard by which all other woods are measured.

material_metadata.name: Pine Log
material_metadata.narrative: Light, flexible wood harvested from tall conifers. Works easily under a blade, bends without breaking.

material_metadata.name: Ash Log
material_metadata.narrative: Pale wood with excellent shock absorption. Weapon handles made from ash feel alive in your grip.

material_metadata.name: Birch Log
material_metadata.narrative: Creamy-white wood from elegant trees. Highly valued for its fine grain and excellent carving properties.

material_metadata.name: Ironwood Log
material_metadata.narrative: Rare wood with metallic properties. As hard as soft metals, holds edges almost as well as iron.

material_metadata.name: Ebony Log
material_metadata.narrative: Deep black wood from ancient forests. Absorbs and nullifies magical energies.

material_metadata.name: Worldtree Log
material_metadata.narrative: Living wood from the World Tree's roots. Contains millennia of accumulated magical essence.

material_metadata.narrative: Reality-bending metal that has transcended conventional physics. Durability frozen in time, effects can occur before cause.

material_metadata.name: Tin Ingot
material_metadata.narrative: Refined tin with excellent magical conductivity. Used in alloys and enchanted items.

material_metadata.name: Tin Ingot
material_metadata.narrative: Refined tin with excellent magical conductivity. Used in alloys and enchanted items.

material_metadata.name: Bronze Ingot
material_metadata.narrative: Bronze alloy forged from copper and tin. Stronger than either parent metal, the ancient alloy that built civilizations. The first lesson in combining materials.

material_metadata.name: Bronze Ingot
material_metadata.narrative: Bronze alloy forged from copper and tin. Stronger than either parent metal, the ancient alloy that built civilizations. The first lesson in combining materials.

material_metadata.name: Limestone
material_metadata.narrative: Common sedimentary rock. Soft enough to carve with basic tools yet strong enough for simple construction.

material_metadata.name: Maple Log
material_metadata.narrative: Dense hardwood with beautiful figuring. Resists warping and holds its shape through temperature extremes.

material_metadata.name: Copper Ore
material_metadata.narrative: A soft, reddish metal found in shallow veins near the surface. Easy to work with basic tools but lacks the durability needed for serious combat. The foundation of all smithing - every blacksmith's first lesson.

material_metadata.name: Iron Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Sturdy grey metal from common deposits throughout the land. The workhorse of civilization - reliable, abundant, and strong enough for most purposes.

material_metadata.name: Tin Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Soft, silvery-white metal with a mysterious sheen that glows faintly in moonlight. Ancient texts speak of its lunar affinity.

material_metadata.name: Steel Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Harder and more durable than pure iron. The secret of its strength lies in its carbon-rich structure. A true warrior's metal.

material_metadata.name: Mithril Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Legendary silver-white metal that seems to drink in moonlight and starshine. Impossibly light yet incredibly strong.

material_metadata.name: Adamantine Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Dark, impossibly hard metal that absorbs light. Found only in the deepest caverns where the world's bones are exposed.

material_metadata.name: Orichalcum Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Gleaming golden metal with an otherworldly green-blue sheen. Ancient civilizations built empires on its discovery.

material_metadata.name: Etherion Ore
material_metadata.narrative: Metal that simultaneously exists in multiple states. Scholars argue whether it's matter or energy, present or future. It is all of these and none.

material_metadata.name: Oak Log
material_metadata.narrative: Reliable, sturdy timber from ancient oaks. Dense grain, strong fibers, and a warm golden-brown hue. The standard by which all other woods are measured.

material_metadata.name: Pine Log
material_metadata.narrative: Light, flexible wood harvested from tall conifers. Works easily under a blade, bends without breaking.

material_metadata.name: Ash Log
material_metadata.narrative: Pale wood with excellent shock absorption. Weapon handles made from ash feel alive in your grip.

material_metadata.name: Birch Log
material_metadata.narrative: Creamy-white wood from elegant trees. Highly valued for its fine grain and excellent carving properties.

material_metadata.name: Ironwood Log
material_metadata.narrative: Rare wood with metallic properties. As hard as soft metals, holds edges almost as well as iron.

material_metadata.name: Ebony Log
material_metadata.narrative: Deep black wood from ancient forests. Absorbs and nullifies magical energies.

material_metadata.name: Worldtree Log
material_metadata.narrative: Living wood from the World Tree's roots. Contains millennia of accumulated magical essence.

material_metadata.name: Copper Ingot
material_metadata.narrative: Refined copper shaped into usable ingots. Malleable, forgiving for beginner crafters, accepts enchantments readily.

material_metadata.name: Tin Ingot
material_metadata.narrative: Refined tin with excellent magical conductivity. Used in alloys and enchanted items.

material_metadata.name: Steel Ingot
material_metadata.narrative: Superior to iron in every way. Holds a keen edge, resists corrosion, and strikes with authority.

material_metadata.name: Fire Crystal
material_metadata.narrative: Orange-red crystal pulsing with trapped flames. Warm to touch, occasionally sparks.
